description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The Innovation & Enterprise Fellowship Programme (IFP) seeks to grow the pool of deep-tech talent in Singapore with the capabilities to support the commercialisation of deep-tech research and bring nascent technologies to market. Targeting researchers, scientists, and engineers (RSEs), the programme aims to develop industry relevant innovation and entrepreneurial skills through both formal and on-the-job training.
At EDDC, our goal is to discover and develop novel therapeutics by working collaboratively with the public sector and industry partners to translate innovations from bench to clinic using industry relevant and cutting-edge technology platforms. This includes tackling complex and unmet medical challenges in disease areas such as oncology, fibrosis, infectious and autoimmune diseases. EDDC is now seeking under the IFP programme a highly motivated bioinformatics/data scientist with expertise in deploying state-of-the-art computational and data-driven approaches for drug discovery and development applications by leveraging insights from large-scale and multi-dimensional data sources.
This is an eighteen month on-the-job training programme that requires participation in and supporting cross-functional and collaborative drug discovery projects. By joining EDDC, the IFP candidate will be part of a dynamic, interdisciplinary team working to evaluate, develop and implement methods and workflows spanning multi-omics data analysis, computational modelling, and machine learning approaches, as well as data-driven strategic decision-making.
Responsibilities:
Evaluate and propose strategies for applying state-of-the-art computational approaches and appropriate tools, develop and implement pipelines for the processing, interpretation, and analysis of high-throughput and multi-dimensional data, to facilitate in-house target and drug discovery research
Investigate novel machine learning and AI methods and platforms to improve or develop new data analysis processes for the discovery of novel drug targets
Establish and manage external strategic partnerships with entities specializing in computational biology, data sciences and AI, acting as a liaison to ensure clear communication between partners and internal project team
Oversee collaboration with wet/dry-lab scientists and data engineers to ensure high-quality data generation, analysis and integration, and to validate and interpret findings from data analysis and machine learning models
Research latest developments in bioinformatics, data sciences, machine learning and AI in drug development, and apply insights from projects and learnings to continuously improve in-house workflow and technology platforms
Requirements:
PhD or equivalent degree in bioinformatics, computer science, statistics, or related field
At least 5 years experience in the processing and analysis of high-throughput sequencing data, including transcriptomics, interactomics, and proteomics data, etc., and proficiency in large-scale text-mining and ‘omics-data mining for novel target discovery
Strong programming skills in R, Python, and/or other languages commonly used in bioinformatics and data sciences, familiarity with HPC and Cloud computing environments
Strong organisational and communication skills, demonstrated ability in establishing and managing research partnerships involving large data analysis, AI, and data science
Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
Willingness to learn new techniques and adapt to changing priorities
Demonstrated knowledge in applying machine learning and AI algorithms for bioinformatics and drug discovery problems
Experienced in the application of computational models and tools for the prediction of RNA structures and features, RNA-ligand interactions and other aspects of RNA biology
Familiarity with databases, database management, and workflow development framework is a plus

The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Overview:
As a Data Scientist, you will leverage your expertise in data analysis, statistical modeling, and machine learning to extract valuable insights from complex datasets. You will play a pivotal role in informing business decisions, solving problems, and driving innovation through data-driven approaches. Collaborating with cross-functional teams, you will develop predictive models, design experiments, and communicate findings to stakeholders.

Key Responsibilities:
Data Analysis and Exploration:
Collect, clean, and preprocess large and diverse datasets to ensure data quality.
Explore and analyze data to identify trends, patterns, and relationships.

Model Development:
Develop predictive and prescriptive models using machine learning, statistical techniques, and data mining methods.
Implement algorithms to solve specific business problems, such as customer segmentation, demand forecasting, or anomaly detection.

Feature Engineering:
Extract relevant features from raw data to improve the performance of predictive models.
Utilize domain knowledge to create meaningful input features for machine learning algorithms.

Model Evaluation and Validation:
Evaluate the performance of models using appropriate metrics and cross-validation techniques.
Fine-tune models to achieve the desired level of accuracy, precision, recall, or other relevant measures.

Data Visualization and Reporting:
Visualize data insights using charts, graphs, and dashboards to effectively communicate findings to non-technical stakeholders.
Create reports summarizing analysis results and actionable recommendations.

Collaboration and Communication:
Collaborate with business analysts, domain experts, and software engineers to define data requirements and model objectives.
Communicate technical concepts and findings to both technical and non-technical audiences.

Experimentation and Hypothesis Testing:
Design and conduct controlled experiments to validate hypotheses and make informed decisions based on experimental results.

Continuous Learning and Innovation:
Stay up-to-date with the latest developments in data science, machine learning, and related fields.
Propose and implement innovative data-driven solutions to address business challenges.

Ethics and Privacy:
Ensure compliance with data privacy regulations and ethical considerations when handling sensitive data.


Qualifications:

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R for data analysis and modeling.
Strong understanding of machine learning algorithms, statistical concepts, and data manipulation.
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Matplotlib, Seaborn, Tableau) to create insightful visualizations.
Knowledge of SQL for querying and extracting data from databases.
Familiarity with machine learning libraries and frameworks (e.g., scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work with complex, unstructured data.
